body_html: @fayeshine: So close! It looks like resize_images goes out of its way to break only if the rank of the input tensor is unknown. Try using shape=None in your placeholder instead of shape=[None, None, None, None] and you should see a problem. However, I'm not sure if this is the same problem that @mackcmillion was experiencing.
body_text: @fayeshine: So close!  It looks like resize_images goes out of its way to break only if the rank of the input tensor is unknown.  Try using shape=None in your placeholder instead of shape=[None, None, None, None] and you should see a problem. body: @fayeshine: So close!  It looks like `resize_images` goes out of its way to break only if the _rank_ of the input tensor is unknown.  Try using `shape=None` in your placeholder instead of `shape=[None, None, None, None]` and you should see a problem.  However, I'm not sure if this is the same problem that  @mackcmillion was experiencing.
